alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Dubois (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:02PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Dubois and northwestern Crawford Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 402 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Jasper, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Crawford and southeastern Dubois Counties, including the following locations... Riceville, Wickliffe, Taswell, Mentor, Schnellville, Birdseye, Eckerty, Mifflin, Kyana and Fargo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for south central Indiana.
